channel.title: Daniel's Development Log
channel.description: After losing a job working in archaic and terrible X3Script, I decided to spend a much larger chunk of my time developing my skills as a developer, rather than waiting for the right work to come to me. This is my blog where I keep track of what I'm working on what I'm learning along the way.

item.title: Hey
item.description:
Hey there

and welcome to Hamilton Central, the one and only fansite dedicated to an accurate textual representation of the musical Hamilton.

def hamilton(alexander)
  print "how does a bastard, orphan, son of a whore and a scotsman..."
end

Have you forgotten how _includes works?

Like this:

{+% include example.ext %+} (with the +’s taken out) includes the file _includes/example.ext, right then and there in the document. Use it anywhere you like.

item.title: Welcome to Jekyll!
item.description:
You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

To add new posts, simply add a file in the _posts directory that follows the convention YYYY-MM-DD-name-of-post.ext and includes the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for this post to get an idea about how it works.

Jekyll also offers powerful support for code snippets:

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll Talk.
